fullText: Review — Buena Vista Social Club The Broadway Review: ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ brings ebullient trova music to Broadway but leaves history behind Marco Ramirez’s musical — a transfer from Off-Broadway — skims over pre- and post-Revolution Cuban life, but vividly displays what came of it: incredible music. , and Brittani Samuel March 20, 2025 . 12:41 AM 10 min read Share on Twitter Share on Facebook Share on LinkedIn Share via Email The cast of “Buena Vista Social Club” on Broadway, 2025 (Credit: Matthew Murphy) This post is for paying subscribers only Subscribe now Already have an account? keyPhrases.quote: Faults in the sometimes wooden acting from principal cast members
eclipsed by the sonic brilliance of it all

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite clear criticism of performances, the critic suggests the musical strengths significantly outweigh the acting weaknesses, implying overall recommendation. | GPT-4o-mini: The review highlights significant strengths in the music but points out notable weaknesses in the performances, leading to a mixed-positive recommendation overall.
